title: GP, Nurse practitioner and reception staff
body: Due to Covid it can be difficult to see the GP but I found the reception, nurse practitioners and my GP excellent. They have been extremely helpful and understanding which I have appreciated. They have gone above and beyond.  Thank you

title: Just wonderful team
body: Cant praise this team enough. After bouncing around different practices in Southport, I have been with this Practice 3 months. Never have difficulty speaking to a clinician, and the staff have really looked after me, especially with mental health issues of my daughter. Cant appreciate their service enough during pandemic.

title: Disorganised
body: I live in wales, my reimbursement was a week late the last quarter, in September, so I was due again today 31st December, didn't get it so rang them and was told I'll probably get it end of January, I said its due every 3 months not 4, they said we'll it's new year's eve what do you expect then the line went dead, so I called back and was told someone would call me back that was 8 hrs ago??? Iam on benefits so was relying on payment, now I'll have to leave my oxygen off till Monday as I don't have any money to top up, I told them this, didn't make any difference to them.

title: Text message
body: I have just received a text message from London Lane clinic telling me that I can buy paracetamol over the counter. Well I totally disagree my doctor wrote me out my prescription with paracetamol on it so that's what I expect. I have not got the money to keep buying it and I am a vulnerable patient

title: Such a helpful member of staff
body: Yesterday I needed to contact the office at Shepperton Medical with a issue with a prescription and found one lady in particular so helpful. I had to make several telephone calls and she was so helpful and professional and sorted out the problem for me - thank you!

title: Thank You
body: I had decompression surgery in late October 2020. My consultant and surgical team explained fully, executed with professionalism and the nursing team post op on Ward 43 were great. Please thank them.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Coventry and Warwickshire NHS Trust

title: Very efficient
body:
I came in to have my Covid vaccine

It worked like clockwork

Someone was complaining about the system - I was called in 13 or 14 minutes late- well mate if that’s all you’ve got to complain about during a worldwide pandemic!!!?

The staff were ultra efficient, processing what seemed like many many patients in a short period of time- perfect model for this type of immunisation program well done!!

title: Very Disappointing
body:
So disappointed with this surgery, im am very understanding with covid changing how we make appointments and see doctors however the only way I can sum up my experience is that they may as well be closed
On several occasions they have fobbed my baby son off to urgent care centres, on both occasions the doctor hasn't even bothered to speak to me to get more information, just the receptionist stating to go to urgent care centres in which they are not happy about his own doctors not seeing him I've also called this morning  regarding myself, the receptionist said the doctor would call me back today and again no call back. I am changing GP practices

title: Vaccination Centre at the Beacon
body: The set-up and organisation were amazingly efficient. There were chairs provided for people waiting. However, there was no queue and all the staff were very friendly and helpful. The entire procedure took less than 1/2 hour including the 15 minutes resting time after the vaccination. Congratulations to the organisers and staff. Very well done.

title: Great Vaccinations!
body: I drove two patients in their eighties for their drive- through Covid  1st vaccinations. It was pouring with rain and the cheerful stewards who guided cars to the bays were kind and helpful, despite being soaked! The medical professional who gave the jabs was helpful, smiling and efficient. We were were very grateful and impressed, thanks to all involved.

title: Great triage and video consultation
body:
The doctor saw my daughter (video) very quickly today - it was very efficient, friendly and reassuring, and the doctor quickly identified the need to go to A&E.

We’re now back from A&E and have a diagnosis and can manage the care at home.

We were really worried so thanks again - and very glad to get seen and sorted before NYE evening.

Also thanks to the member of staff on reception who ensured we got the call back today.

title: My first trip to the theatre since lockdown.
body: Delightfully charming cast. Lighting and camera-angle artfully enhanced the experience and my pre-colonoscopy cocktail was a dizzying treat! ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

readBy.name: King's College Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Friendly Staff
body: I am a wheelchair user. Went in today and it's often difficult for me to get about but the Friendly Receptionist lad was very sweet! Got helped out with the lift and overall a great experience to the doctors lol. 5/5 stars!

title: Very well run
body: I attended for a covid vaccination and found the whole experience outstanding. The staff knew exactly what was going on despite large numbers of people. They were polite and I was amazed with the efficiency. Thanks you HMP

title: A++++ Care Received
body:
30.12.20 arrived Arrowe park by ambulance, two paramedics were amazing, can't thank you enough for easing the horrific pain I was enduring. 30.12.2020 assessed in A&E, all nurses and doctor again wonderful and made sure I was comforted when upset, after a couple of hours i went on ward 54 where I had stay in that night.
All staff on night and next day shift 31.12.2020  were outstanding what great care they took of me from the lovely nurse who did my scan to the porter, what a lovely man he was, made me feel at ease, the anesthetists, doctors, scrubs, and surgeons talked me through all procedures that was to be undertaken clearly and very professional, all staff members have a great qualities! people skills, care and a great sence of humour to make you smile. Thank you so so much I have been left very humbled by your duty of care.
JM

readBy.name: Wirral University Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Disappointing....but not a surprise
body:
First off I appreciate that the NHS is under major systemic pressure with Co-vid, but my comment is based on comparison with other surgeries who are under the same pressure. 

You will have read about the appointment system, I haven't found this an issue as they hold back appointments as indicated by the responses for on the day.

You will have read about the "communication skills" of the receptionists, so what can I say their attitude isn't the best and could be significantly improved. 

My main issue is their inability to manage the delivery of service, what is the point of messaging in the third week of November about the flu vaccine if you don't follow-up? Paraphrasing "Dear Patient do you want the flu vaccine?", response "Yes", 7 weeks later..nothing. Other practices deliver this next day, now I am not expecting that from Central Surgery, but next month maybe?

To be clear I think the NHS is great, but the variation of service across it is a Post Code lottery..and if you are in KT6 maybe find another practice.

title: Caring Practice.
body: In what are very challenging  times for health professionals the staff at Burma Hills dealt with my problem with kindness and sensitivity. I got the treatment I needed even though it was difficult to get an appointment.

title: Dedicated staff who deserve praise
body: Admitted NYE . The two doctors who saw to me were professional and kind. What they have to go through in a pandemic is unthinkable and yet I was still treated as an individual, I felt so cared so. Thank you so much , you have my respect and utmost thanks

author: Chris1947
title: Brilliant staff
body:
I was sent for an assessment to the clinic in Newry.  
I just want to say thanks very much to Chloe, Joanne, Ann Marie, Dr Phelim who were absolutely brilliant and made me feel so much at ease.  
Can’t thank them enough they were brilliant

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Diagi9
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Bereavement support
body: The support given to me by John Taylor Hospice's bereavement team really helped. It enabled me to move forward from a very difficult place. I would like to say a big thank you for that help.

author: Happy  Hearer
title: Cardiology department
body:
Went for an echocardiogram procedure at Musgrove Park Hospital  
Everything was streamlined and I felt completely safe in the department  
Well Done and thank you all

title: Emergency outpatient visit
body: New Years Eve, but was still accepted to be seen on the day as an emergency outpatient visit. Consultant very professional, explained everything clearly & took time and care. Nursing staff exceptionally friendly & kind. NHS at its best.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

author: Bop
title: Having a colonoscopy
body: Very nervous to begin with but staff, in particular Simon were first class. Their care, and professionism was excellent. I was kept fully informed at all times with Simon talking to me throughout the procedure to put me at ease. Overall an excellent team.

author: les172
title: Covid 19 injections
body: My wife is registered as priority for Covid 19. She is 95 and bedbound and cannot go out and has other medical conditions. We are both given flu injections at home. I hear that many local people have already had Covid 19 injections. As priority patients, how soon will we be able to have our injections at home?

readBy.name: Dorset HealthCare University NHS Foundation Trust

author: AC Falkirk
title: Giving me my life back
body: In December 2019 I had a heart episode. I had this problem for a few months. Forth Valley hospital took care of me from start to finish, from paramedics to cardiology. Due to covid, as myself and many others that were affected, nothing apart from tablets happened. I had my wee op in November at the Golden Jubilee and must admit although it went well I had felt crap for a couple of weeks (I think my body was just adjusting). I have now fully enjoyed Christmas and a couple of hours away from enjoying 2021. I just want to say THANK YOU to all the NHS staff that helped me on my road to recovery. Have a great new year and keep up the good work.

readBy.name: Office of Angus MacDonald, MSP for Falkirk East

author: Rainbow23
title: Birth of our 4th baby
body:
Our son was born on 9th December at Royal Victoria Maternity hospital.  
I tried to ring admissions before we came to the hospital but couldn’t get anyone on the phone so I went on up to the hospital and arrived around 8pm  
Both the midwife (can’t remember her name) and the doctor (Angelo) were both great and arranged for me to be admitted to Ward A around 11.30pm on 8th December. While I wasn’t technically in labour (was having contractions but cervix was closed) they were concerned as I had been bleeding heavily (I had a haemorrhage following the birth of baby number 3 so this put me in the at risk category).  
While in ward A the staff there were great again, the midwife was very helpful. I continued having contractions which increased in intensity. Asked for gas & air around 1.30am - 2am but was told I should try other pain relief such as co-codamol (which I accepted but didn’t make a difference). I then called the same midwife around 3am to say my contractions were very intense, midwife checked me and said I was 3-4cm. She said I could have a bath or go to delivery room. I knew the labour was progressing very fast even though the midwife didn’t seem to think so, I said I wanted to go to the delivery room. At 3.30am they said I could go round to delivery room so they told me to call my husband to come up to the hospital. I then packed up my stuff (with the help of the midwife and other nursing staff) and I walked round to the delivery room at 3.40am and was handed over to another midwife. Baby was born at 4.12am...luckily my husband got there just in time. The midwife even remarked that the baby had come a lot quicker than she expected.  
I can’t recommend the staff highly enough as I think they were all very helpful especially as I was very anxious about the possibility of another haemorrhage (which thankfully didn’t happen). My husband was allowed to stay for as long as he wanted (he had to go home just before 8am to get our older kids to school). Very thorough and I couldn’t have asked for a better midwife.  
I was transferred to Johnstone house (to keep an eye on me for a few hours to ensure no haemorrhage). Again the staff there and the midwife were amazing. I was discharged around 6pm that same day. Johnstone house is great and I felt like I was in a hotel!  
To summarise I think all the staff were amazing especially working under the covid restrictions. I did wear my face mask most of the time until I got to the delivery room. Only thing that I wasn’t happy with, was that I wasn’t able to speak to anyone in admissions before I came up to the hospital but I assume the staff were overwhelmed with patients at that time.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: VampireFriend
title: Marvellous people and reasons to celebrate
body:
Venesection at FVR Day Medicine Unit ~ Venesection Suite.  
Venesection no.6, I intended to post a photo of the treatment site. Sorry no photo ~ as there is nothing to see. No bruise, almost invisible pin prick! Amazing when I think about the needle Cathy wields! This care/treatment has been the highlight of 2020 for me (anyone knowing this exists must feel the same?) No surgery, no medication ~ simple blood drawing. I have worded that wrongly...looks simple when an expert is doing the blood drawing!This time 2019 I was so despondent, no energy, sad, sore and losing weight. Thankful my GP did blood tests and followed through to diagnose my genetic condition. Even more thankful to have consultant appt and treatment. I am full of hope, positivity and energy levels are improving.Cathy and her team are invaluable; saving patients from complicated illness and procedures: if only everyone was tested when we presented with non-specific, pain, fatigue and vague "unwell" symptoms the NHS and patients would be in a much better place!  
To All at the Medical Day Unit and Cathy and Venesection Team....You made my 2020 "Nae Sae Bad" and I know you will make my 2021 the year I get young again! Have a Happy New Year, May you have Health, Happiness and Prosper in all your endevours!

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: Dbs1975
title: Still waiting for scan results
body:
I’m very disappointed, my ct scan was in October 2020 and I’ve still not had results to find my problem. Following up with 3 phone calls, as my foot is still numb and now my back /hip been playing up.  
I was told there was a backlog which I understand in this pandemic... but we’re now into 2021 and still no results.

author: MAR1642
title: I was diagnosed with bowel cancer
body:
I was late for my bowel cancer screening which was due in April 2020. Due to the Corona virus lockdown I did not receive my screening until the end of October 2020. The delay concerned me a great deal and I worry that it could have a negative impact on the final outcome  
The screening practitioner did a good consultation and eas very informative. After screening, the results were fast returned. The preop booking was very good and so was the enhanced recovery programme. The pain buster was very good, I felt very little pain. The care at Woodlands by all staff was excellent  
It would have been good if there was a shorter time between diagnosis and operation, and there was a lack of information and care at KGH.

readBy.name: Kettering General Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Always reliable
body:
I have been suffering with chronic abdominal pain since December 2018 - and it’s not been easy to diagnose especially with Covid effecting the hospitals, however the staff at Crouch Oak have always responded to my medical needs promptly, professionally and with a great deal of compassion.
I have always felt cared for, my issues are currently ongoing but I feel like I have access to an amazing team at Crouch Oak to see me through

title: Wonderful
body: Great well run practice excellent GPs. and  nurses always able to get an appointment last minute pre covid .

title: Excellent service
body: I needed to use the service after a fall in icy conditions, sustaining damage to my wrist. All the staff - reception, cleaners, nurses, doctors, and radiographer were very helpful and provided a prompt and highly professional service.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Morecambe Bay NHS Foundation Trust

title: Good experience
body: I came in for the vaccination. Despite the scale of activity, the logistics were well scaled to the requirements. Things worked very efficiently. The entire experience was excellent. Well done!

title: Excellent Service
body: I attended yesterday for my first Covid vaccination. Despite large numbers of patients we were all managed in a safe, efficient and caring way. Superb practice staff.

title: Great practice
body: This is a great practice with extremely helpful staff. We have been with this practice from 2002 and always have appointment when requested, prescription when requested, and referral to hospital when needed. I would recommend this practice to anybody who arrives in the area. Simply the best.

title: coronavirus vaccination
body:
Message:
I feel it important to express how impressed I was at the smoothness of the organisation for my first Covid vaccination on Friday ,18th December.
Not only was the information process handled well but the atmosphere in the vaccination room felt very professional whilst maintaining warmth and pleasantness.
The effort put into making us patients comfortable was evident despite the enormity of the organisational task.
Resounding congratulations and thanks to all.

title: Wow wow wow
body: Amazing and a credit to the nhs. The care and kindness I was shown whilst being in hospital was amazing and I am so thankful to have them as my local hospital. Thank you to all who looked after me and made me better.

author: Ddstego
title: Food in Hospital
body: I have been in a few times in the past month and all the food has been excellent. A huge improvement from when I was in ward 10 five year’s ago

title: Wonderful Service
body:
I planned to visit Portugal Nov-Jan 2020. While away Coronovirus cases increased rapidly so we decided to staying another 2 months. 

I needed another 2 months meds. On contacting the surgery for advice via their website, I received an immediate acknowledgment reply followed by an email suggesting they email a copy of my prescription. That was done & I was able to buy my meds at a pharmacy where I’m staying. 

Thank you!!

title: Excellent Supportive Staff and Service
body: Having a cancer diagnosis so close to Christmas was shocking. However, from testing through to treatment I could not have asked for anything more from the caring team. This includes admin, nurses, HCA's, Dr's, Macmillan nurse support and everyone else in the background. I felt totally in safe hands and felt genuinely cared for by the magnificent team. Obviously I was anxious and scared but once in the hospital for my operation the support was excellent and they helped alleviate all fears. When I had an issue with a wound on the ward the Dr was contacted and came to see me as soon as he was out of surgery. The team obviously respect and care about each other and this has created a brilliant working environment for them and great patient experience. Your student nurse is going to be fantastic. Only two slight negatives, lack of phone reception meant contact with family especially during covid stressful but the staff helped and offered options where they could. This is totally out of their hands. The second item was the food, this was like a time warp and not pleasant. However, don't let this detract from the excellent experience I had at the hospital. Thank you so much, I am now celebrating the New Year after a phone call to say I am cancer free. Happy New Year to our NHS Heroes who are working tirelessly through out the country.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: Excellent Boothroyd centre
body: My husband attended the Boothroyd Centre yesterday for an Endoscopy.When he arrived home he couldn't praise them enough.He said the staff were caring,efficient and very knowledgeable. He was attended to promptly and everyone put him at ease immediately. He followed all the instructions to the letter prior to the appointment and the staff told him how much they appreciated that.We would both like to wish all of the staff a very happy new year and hope that their load will be lightened in 2021,fingers crossed.Thank you all once again.

title: Superb service
body:
Can't fault the care and treatment I had here, staff were so helpful and friendly and all so polite.
The cleanliness was 100%, everybody there should be proud of the way the whole hospital is run.

readBy.name: St Helens and Knowsley Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Covid vaccination
body: Was called today to see if I was available for a Covid vaccination - you bet I was! Well organised system, please pass my thanks to all involved, they are doing a great job under difficult circumstances.

title: A very caring and positive experience
body: Our GP referred us up to the paediatric unit with our 6 year old son who was in great pain and unable to bear any weight on one leg. He was seen quickly and made to feel at ease. Each nurse and doctor he saw spoke to him with kindness and humour. Although still in pain he was examined with gentleness and care. After a thorough check-up the diagnosis was clearly explained to him as well as to dad and they were sent home with a clear way forward and with follow up care should we need it. At the end of a distressing and painful day for him, our son was more comfortable and content. He had been afraid of going to hospital but has had such a positive experience that he's not afraid anymore. Many thanks to the whole team who saw him on 30th Dec. He's back to bouncing around and causing mayhem!

title: Exemplary and human
body:
All staff were exceptional; cleaners, consultants, nurses, OT, dieticians, physio, and HCAs were all brilliant. Also the food and menu choice was of a very high standard, especially when catering for such huge numbers.

You all work with great professionalism, whilst also being very kind and caring. Your warmth, kindness and humanity was very important to me and definitely made a difference to my recovery (in addition to the high level of medical skills and experience.)

I’ve visited Musgrove a few times over the past 2 years and I can say the same about each department and ward I’ve visited – a high standard of care and connection to the patient seems to be widespread throughout the whole hospital

You also gave great support to my family, with good communication and understanding, giving reassurance to my brother when needed. This was very helpful for me to know that he was supported and able to get clear information when needed.

I can only say that you are exemplary and your work and dedication is much appreciated. Your patience and kindness whilst working under the current very stressful situation is nothing short of heroic!

Just thank you a million times.

title: great service
body: having an infusion  of zoledronic acid for the first time the staff were very reassuring and kind which helped me to be relaxed  and i cant praise them enough for their understanding

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Amazing Service From Start to Finish
body:
I am writing to say what amazing service we have had from Addenbrooke's.  From the time we saw the security guard (you know who you are M) all the way through the process of looking after my father on New Years Eve.
You are all amazing and you are the best in the world.

readBy.name: Cambridge University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Absolutely disgusted with service
body: Been here for years been a pretty good practice but now been totally let down by the service since Covid I have not been seen by the surgery even though I need an injection every 10 weeks! Because of this condition has got worse and eventually spoke to new Doctor not interested even though tests say I need help. Looking to move to another practice now shame.

title: Good GPs but terrible administration and…
body: The administration is so bad it's almost dangerous.  You cannot get appointments, the staff say one thing then something else, when you are desperate for help they stare at you blankly.  Not able to get to see a GP since 10/2019, it's over a year.  Never get test results, they follow nothing through, provide no follow-up care.  The GPs themselves when you -can- see or speak to one seem very nice, but the overall system and sheer incompetence of the administrative side lets them down.

title: Fob you off and do nothing to resolve issue
body: Having problems getting repeat prescription in relation to medication prescribed by hospital.  Surgery saying have not received letter off hospital. This is not the 1st time and cannot be put down to COVID. There have been 2 previous occasions prior to COVID where said not received letters. Had phone consultation on Tuesday 29th, doctor said would get it chased up and if I could also chase it. Doctor also said if heard nothing by Friday to call. I chased up with hospital same day who said would put letter in post. Realised after consultation that Friday is Bank Holiday. I therefore called on the Thursday, spoke to receptionist, who said no letter had been received. Receptionist said that there were no notes to say they will be chasing it up just that I would chase up. I advised this was all a bit dubious as the doctor had also advised me to call Friday when the surgery is closed. Reception asked if I could ring hospital again  and ask for it to be sent via email. Spoke to hospital secretary who said would email it right away and secretary advised that original letter was sent on 10th December.  Rang surgery at 12.59 pm to advise hospital sending letter via email asked if they could ring me in 1 hour to let me know either way if received email, the receptionist agreed to do this but not once did she mention they were closing early. No call by 2.15pm so rang but surgery now closed for bank holiday. Medication still not sorted total incompintence.  Back at work myself on Monday so will not have time to do their job as well as my own, so who knows when I will get my medication. Totally uncaring and lack of understanding of their responsibilities and duty of care.

title: Amazing practise
body: I moved to East Riding and service was terrible and them moved back 5 years latter to long stratton and was amazing at the level of service I get from this practise. I am a transplant receiver and since registration I’ve had done problems and with covid 19 around they have gone above and beyond being fantastic from actually seeing them on a number of occasions and being sent to the consultants. Also changing drugs running out of drugs and always willing to help get what I need. All this with being so polite and helpfully. They are a credit to the service they do and all from the receptionist to the nurses and docs you are just brilliant. Many thanks.

title: Failed appointment
body: Had a telephone appointment booked in for today at 11.45 still not heard from them, been chasing it up since 12.45 keep getting passed around to different departments, booking line giving me the wrong number finally got through to someone at main outpatients, attitude stank no apology for the failed call had to ask him to try chasing it up for me which he was hesitant to do couldn’t give me any more information 1 hour 20 mins later still waiting for this call

title: Worst experience
body: I am a 28 year girl old who experienced hair loss back in 2017, I didn’t get my appointment until this year 2020 November. I met the doctor and was told that my hair loss is permanent And the quicker I treat it the better the outcome she booked me a biopsy and urgent blood test. I had my blood test and then get a biopsy appointment  for April, a few days later the appointment is canceled no reason given. I call but no one knows why it has been canceled and the clinic are not responding. My initial diagnosis is discoid lupus hair loss with scarring so unless treated the effect is permanent now I get a phone call appointment booked for July? Seriously a phone call appointment How is that a solution. It has caused me extreme stress imagine being a 28 year old girl losing your hair and knowing It won’t be growing back. Apart from psychological suffering. I feel physical pain in my scalp that keeps me awake. I’ve only been ignored so far, my mental and physical health is not even considered when making such decisions.

title: No information on website re vaccine rollout
body: I am Caring for 93 year old cancer patient who is shielding. Have yet to receive any information regarding administration of vaccine. No news on practice website.

title: ‘urgent to you, doesn’t mean it is for us’
body:
Were the words of a member of the secretary team when I called weeks after giving birth and was in severe pain with stitches. Despite recently giving birth I was refused appointments because of the pandemic and offered no alternative support. I have also had to fight to get my sons vaccination appointments in the diary and have no follow up appointments from the GP about my care, in fact I am not sure they even knew I had given birth. 

‘Just because it is urgent to you, doesn’t mean it is for us’ 

I have removed myself and my family from the surgery and am advising others in my family to do the same. Medical advice should not be given out by the secretary staff and help should be offered in one way or another.

title: Excellent Service
body: I don't usually leave reviews but the experience and treatment I received from this hospital was outstanding! Not only excellent professionalism of the surgeons but the staff overall were considerate and very hospitable . Thankyou to ALL the staff at the Holbrook centre .

readBy.name: St Helens and Knowsley Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Really helpful and friendly staff
body: Our daughter attended for a minor surgical procedure. At first we went to the wrong building. The receptionist there couldn't have been more helpful in pointing us in the right direction. Additionally, a nurse phoned through to the correct ward and told staff there we were on our way. A member of the cleaning staff was also helpful in telling us where we needed to go once in the main hospital building. Subsequently, while waiting for our daughter to have her operation (admittedly, a few hours, but not unexpected), a nurse asked us if we wanted a drink and gave us some biscuits. Small gestures, perhaps, but ones that were very much appreciated. The procedure was a success and our daughter felt she'd had received a great service. Many thanks.

title: Concerning lack of communication and…
body:
My mother has been at this hospital since 19th December. Currently still in as she contracted covid at the hospital. When calling to get update and to arrange a zoom call with mum we are finding that it’s always an inconvenience and staff are being rude with us. We try asking for a time for us to call tobest suit them but consistently we are told to call
Back in an hour. Also considering mum is on a covid Ward it’s highly concerning that when I go to collect her washing after 4 dats I get only one pair of pyjamas and two underwear garments. Doesn’t seem infection control is high on their priority list?  Staff sigh on the phone when asked about how mum is doing and say. We have other patients to look after.  Is it asking too much to get one daily update on how mums progress is going? I myself am a health care worker and am shocked an concerned at the lack of communication, empathy and understanding they show. Mum looks utterly depressed. She has lung cancer and has been in hospital since 10th Dec and is missing us her family.  I understand and appreciate the strains and pressure they are undergoing as I myself feel those too in my career. But it is absolutely NO excuse for them to lower their duty of care standards. We feel highly worried concerned and utterly unsupported by the covid Ward at this hospital.  Maybe them not coming into contact with families is making them care less about the ripple effect this is spreading heart break and stress to loved ones of patients there?  I myself will fight against any family members going into that hospital ever again

title: Fantastic care
body:
I had been sick since Christmas Day, so got an online GP appointment, as I was not getting better. The GP listened carefully to my symptoms, gave me advice and got me an immediate prescription. She also arranged urgent blood tests for that same day. She phoned me back the next morning with my blood test results.
The GP suggested I had a COVID test, due to this new strain of the virus having some different symptoms from the previous strain.
I got an appointment booked for that day. All the staff in the test centre were amazing too. Very friendly and helpful.

As somebody who is in the clinically extremely vulnerable group, I was very worried by my symptoms. 

Of course, I don’t yet have my COVID test results, but I do feel a lot safer due to the high standard of care I received.

Thank you.

Liz

title: SPK transplant
body:
I have recently had a simultaneous pancreas and kidney transplant and would like to thank everyone that looked after me when I was in hospital and also everyone who is still looking after me.
From receiving the telephone call from the transplant co-ordination team to coming home two weeks later everyone was fantastic. I would especially like to thank the surgeons who performed the operation and to the staff that looked after me in HDU and on the transplant ward.
This is an incredibly tough job under normal circumstances but as we all know 2020 has been anything but normal!!
All the time I was in hospital I felt in safe hands , all the staff are well trained and extremely good at their jobs, I have nothing but admiration for everyone who works here.
Thank you all for giving me the best Christmas present anyone could ask for!!!
I hope things improve with the COVID situation soon so everyone stay safe and keep well.
All my best wishes to everyone 
Steve McConway.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: High quality service.
body: From start to finish my experience was one of extreme professionalism from all staff I came into contact with. This engendered in me a feeling of confidence, enabling me to relax in the knowledge that I was in safe hands, and feeling that my cataract operation would be carried out successfully, which it was.

title: Great practice
body: The GP’s at this surgery are fantastic. Professional & caring. I can’t fault them on my experiences every time. I started today with a miserable and uncomfortable urinary tract infection and seriously wondered if I could be seen today. I got through to reception very quickly by telephone and was offered telephone consultation. I expected some sort of wait but was promptly contacted by phone by a very professional and caring doctor, who assessed my symptoms meticulously ,provided me with a prescription and a follow up appointment for following week. My uncomfortable condition was dealt with very speedily .I never cease to be amazed at the superb service provided by the Ladygate Lane Surgery. I have been registered with the practice for 15  odd years, and the service goes from strength to strength. A big thank you to all the staff

title: A and E visit
body: I attended the hospital wed. Afternoon and was seen within 15 minutes.  I was given a number of tests by courteous and attentive staff.  The service could not have been more efficient and the outcome was good.  Thank you to all members of the unit.

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very cooperative all In surgery
body:
Well spoken and well mannered receptionists and helpful Doctors too
God bless all of them I have been under the care he for last over 20 years
Quite happy staying here

title: Wonderful service
body: Lovely people, kind efficient and thoughtful - great practice. Was seen on time, minimal waiting despite Covid problems, treatment was painless and all staff very kind and courteous. Happy new year

title: I feel so grateful and proud to leave a five star…
body:
I feel so grateful that I am a patient at Friarsgate Practice in Weeke.  They have been so kind and attentive during the course of this pandemic.
On the day that I have requested one, I have had phone calls and zoom calls with my Doctor.  They are still dealing efficiently with my prescription requests.
Some of my family (my Parents in particular) haven't even had a call from their surgery right from the beginning of this situation.  They are both over 80 and my Mother is vulnerable.
All of the Staff are very helpful and go that one step further to help, if they possibly can.
In fact, they have maintained the same standard of patient care throughout this awful time.
I would like to raise a glass in celebration to all at Friarsgate Practice and wish them a very, very Happy New Year!
Thanks for all your hard work.

title: E consult another reason not to give you an…
body: Th new e consult it is awful, if you are mentally unwell or physically unwell it would Be very hard to fill out this very long form. You then get an email with when you should receive a call or email. So far I have been over prescribed medication I am supposed to be tapering off as discussed when I actually managed to talk to a human because they just email me they prescribed it instead of calling me and my latest consult today, no email, no call to discuss the few issues I have just another prescription doled out, I wanted to speak with my doctor.

title: Very helpful
body: Usually very helpful receptionist and excellent GP. I have never had a bad experience and have to attend quite regularly.

title: All Star Cast at Granton Medical Centre
body: Amazing doctors, nurses and receptionists. Was feeling vile with non-Covid problem in midst of pandemic, thus concerned about troubling anyone. How wrong I was. Superb care has me 'on the mend.' If there was a medical Oscar the  Granton staff would win 'Best Practice' - no contest.

title: Thank you to all the amazing staff.
body: I was very anxious about being there but the staff were very understanding and more than helpful. Thank you to all involved.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Morecambe Bay NHS Foundation Trust

title: out in the cold
body: I took my wife to an appointment at the surgery where after confirming her appointment was told to wait outside with other patients  for at least 15 min in below freezing temperatures what is the point of a heated waiting room with no one in it masks were being worn.

title: Terrible service
body: I filled in a online form for a sick note due to the phone just ringing out, i didnt receive my note. So i called the doctors to request my note, got a call back and was fine. Then i got a text msg saying please call surgery to add email address to the system which they already have. So i did but again phone ringing out! Ive tried several times and just rings out, states online its open but nothink! Ive had to wait over a week now for my sick note which my employer is not happy about! Very annoying and unprofessional, i had a sick note sent to me via text so i am very confused and now i wont get paid due to this delay! Terrible service !!!!

title: Kind and approachable
body: I rarely go to the GP, but have had reason to do so twice recently. On both occasions the service was prompt and kindly. When we are all feeling the pressure of Covid a kindly primary care service is a thing of great value. Thank you to Longrove - and the new premises are good too.

title: Great treatment
body: Upon arriving Xmas night my treatment/asessments,were amazing,efficient,caring lots of compassion.worsr In these times of covid,so it was also scary,but I didn't  feel unsafe at any point

readBy.name: North Middlesex University Hospital NHS Trust

title: Almost gave up
body: For 4 days trying to get through i gave up and took pen to paper. I was held in a que number 5/4/3/2/1 then cut off.waiting time on the phone was between 15 and 45 minutes. I have been with this practice for 50 years and watched it decline regarding getting through to the surgeries and booking appointments. Eventually i was contacted by a member of staff,almost a week later.she explained the problem with the phone issue and said it was being looked into.After a long discussion she assured me the problem i had experienced the week before would not happen again and if i couldn't get through to the surgery i would receive a call back now my phone number had been logged. I havnt had to get intouch with the practice yet so i will have to wait and see if this is true.lets hope in 2021 we can all get a better service all round.Good luck and happy new year village medical centre.

author: geminizj89
title: My mum
body: My mum fell and banged her head. She developed a subsural hematoma and whilst getting treatment for that contracted Covid-19. I felt powerless and full of anguish because I couldn’t see, comfort or help my Mum. The staff at every ward and each hospital that treated my Mum are exceptional people - the specialists, the general care, the health services all of the integrated teams. And as a relative they also treated us with (a lot) of patience. The NHS is incredible in theory and practice. My family are indebted to your brilliance, hard work and compassion.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: dn82
title: Surgery for mole removal
body: I had an appointment with dermatology then need a mole take out. Appointment wait time wasn’t long, surgery was on time, surgeon & especially the nurse were amazing.

author: Loughmallon131
title: My mother can’t use a phone.
body: The FaceTime was set up snd I could to mum each day. When she was went to hospital mum got abit confused in it. Now each day that she see me there is no confusion. She doesn’t feel abandoned. This service is unreal especially for the elderly that can’t use the internet. Wish I could do something to help only I’m a carer I definitely volunteer. If financial help was needed be only to happy to support it. Can’t thank everyone that helps out in this service enough. Gaves me peace of mind to see her and gaves her contentment to no we still here for her.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Sincerely yours
title: A real gift at this very difficult time
body:
Mum, 97, tested positive for covid in December 2020. During her time on the covid ward in Daisy Hill the wonderfull team of nurses, understaffed and at times probably overwhelmed, did their utmost to facilitate virtual visits. Sincere thanks to them all.  
Mum was moved to rehab after three weeks. Since then the virtual visits have been arranged by a non nursing team, such a gift for the families and the already pressurised nursing team.  
The virtual visit team are so efficient, empathetic and lovely to speak to. Visits can be arranged that day and can also be booked several days in advance. Visits always happen at the scheduled time. Sincere thanks to all of you. Being able to speak to and see mum is a real gift at this very difficult time.  
Keep up the great work. God bless.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Caroil
title: Skin lesions removed
body:
I attended the Dermatology Department at Stirling Community Hospital to have two skin lesions surgically removed by David and Lesley. They are a wonderful team - professional, skilled, competent, caring, funny, friendly and kind. I had previously had a lesion removed by them and was delighted I was seeing them again. They greeted me warmly, explained the procedure, made sure I was comfortable and kept me relaxed.  
The surgeries were carried out most professionally with particular attention to cleanliness, keeping the sites sterile, surgical skill and with full Covid 19 protection - all of this without any fuss but with humour and compassion. They were also able to chat and amuse me to make the procedure and time pass easily.  
Without doubt, David and Lesley are the A Team of Dermatology Minor Ops and I was so fortunate to be under their care again. I had total confidence in them to do an excellent job and knew I was in safe hands.  
Lesley also gave me samples of various creams to try out to improve my eczema. She kindly gave me advice about their use and how to obtain them by prescription.  
I must also acknowledge the parts played by Dr Craig, nurse Brenda Smith and Alanna the receptionist. They all helped me deal with worrying lesions and I thank them sincerely.  
This was the NHS at its best - thank you all!

author: Dionnex
title: NHS 24 + Out of Hours Service
body:
I had been struggling last Sunday I was already being treated with antibiotics but I’d began vomiting and was in pain. I called NHS 24 I was aware that the service demand was high and eventually after. 1 hour and 30 minutes I got through.  
I spoke to a call handler called David (I think was his name) he was very supportive and listened to the information I was giving him. He went through all the appropriate questions and he spoke to one of the other clinicians for me who was also very kind. I was told I would wait up to 4 hours for someone to call back but after 15 minutes a doctor had phoned and discussed things with me.  
The doctor was really nice she listened and was very thorough. I do have endometriosis so have been in this difficult situation before and NHS 24 and the hospital have had to help me in the past. The doctor did suggest some things we could try and then she asked me “what has helped you in the past when this has happened? ” and I had told her and she agreed that this was a suitable plan. She arranged for me to be seen at the Western General Hospital.  
The clinician I seen (unsure if she was a doctor or a nurse) she was very good. She listened to me and did all the appropriate checks before agreeing that we could go down the intramuscular injection route and see how I got on with that. Once she had done that she gave advice about what to do if I found it didn’t work and told me to call straight back. She was very understanding which really did help especially at a time I was struggling. Thank you NHS 24 + Western General Hospital.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: 1stxr47
title: Giving recognition to the professionalism shown.
body:
I called maternity triage very late at night this week due concern about reduced fetal movements @ 35 weeks. The midwife on the phone was very polite and listened to my concern and advised I needed to attend to be checked. She did advise that the department was busy and to bring refreshments with me.  
I arrived with my husband and as explained they had no capacity to see me straight away. My husband stayed outside in corridor until I was called which was very surprisingly only after 10/15 mins.  
I was seen by a midwife ( unfortunately I cannot remember her name) who was very polite, professional and welcoming and put me at ease. I was placed on motioning and my BP & HR were checked. My husband was allowed in while monitoring continued for 30mins.  
After this time everything was ok with my babies movements and reassurance was given by the midwife.  
I am a nurse and know all too well the pressure the staff are under during this pandemic and I would like to provide some positive feedback for the staff working that night and give recognition to the professionalism shown.  
This is the second time during my pregnancy where I have had a positive experience with maternity and antenatal care.

author: tobias62
title: A cataract removed from the right eye.
body:
Appointments were made for consultation with Dr Puri at Ilkeston Hospital Derbyshire Who was very reassuring. The appointment for the procedure was then made. I was a little apprehensive about the procedure. The nurses were efficient and told me what they were doing at all times which was putting eyedrops before the procedure Dr Puri then came and told me it it would only take about 20mins to do the procedure. I was taken to theatre were more eyedrops and the anaethsetic were instilled. The nurse and Doctor were very reassuring . After the procedure the nurse took me to the office and explained how to use my eye drops during the after care.  
I felt a little shaky But the nurse escorted me down the corridor where my wife was waiting. It is five days since my cataract was removed and at present I am pleased with the result.

readBy.name: Derbyshire Community Health Services NHS Foundation Trust

author: Aquinosu
title: My 87 year old Mum was taken into hospital unexpectedly.
body:
Mum was afraid to go to hospital due to COVID and her family was worried for her but hospital care was necessary for her condition.
I live in the US along with one other family member and the rest live in Northern Ireland and since my Father passed away 2 years ago I call my Mum every day before I go to work to see how she is. My Mum is registered blind with only minimal vision so I cannot call her directly on a cell phone as she can’t see to answer it.
I was so pleased one of my Sisters told me about the virtual visit service and I have used it quite a few times over the last few weeks my Mum has been in hospital. It was a blessing to see and speak to my Mum to let her know we were thinking of her and praying for her.
Mum was able to assure me that she was getting wonderful care from all the Nurses, Doctors and Care Staff at the hospital.
Speaking and seeing my Mum is always important but especially now during COVID and with living so far away and so I am grateful for the time I have to see and talk with Mum during my virtual visit.
THANK YOU

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: browserpw58
title: My treatment was first class
body:
I attended Queen Margaret Hospital Day Surgery Unit in December 2020 for removal of my gall bladder, due to gallstones. I received clear information in the lead up to the op. The process of having a covid test (on Boxing Day!) went smoothly and my negative test result meant the operation could go ahead. I had socially distanced for 14 days prior to the op, and I was in self isolation straight after the Covid test. This process, plus the way the Hospital was organised, made me feel 100% safe about going into hospital.  
On the day, all the members of the staff team involved in my care introduced themselves and explained their role. I felt that everone had a positive attitude and made me feel very confident in their level of skill.  
My treatment was first class - pre op, anaesthesia, surgery, recovery, and discharge.  
I am full of gratitude and admiration to the staff team in partucular and to the NHS in general for providing my treatment. It was my first ever time in hospital (at age 63) and I feel so lucky that these services are available for free.

author: TheClarkies
title: Absolutely fantastic
body: Absolutely fantastic service. Organised a call for the same day. FaceTime happened at arranged time. Outstanding in these unprecedented times. Thank you so much.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Fantastic service from all staff
body: The receptionist listened and did her best to help me although there were no more appointments available she managed to get the nurse practitioner to phone me and she managed to prescribe me the relevant medication. Also she advised me that if i feel the same next week to phone back and get an appoinement for an x-ray. Just a fantastic surgery

title: Amazing Coordinated Team Work
body: I was taken to Leeds GI by ambulance following 111 call re chest pains.  The ambulance team were able to take me straight to the treatment room.  Where the team introduced themselves (sorry cannot remember any name).  But I can remember how impressive the whole situation was dealt with.  I was asked questions and was advised I may have had a heart attack. The shock of hearing this is hard to describe.  Everything was explained to me clearly and even after the compulsory doom laden warnings of what may happen these were followed by clear and concise statements of what each of the team were doing during the angiogram procedures. I found this an enormous reassurance and a sense of real professionalism and real care towards me as the patient. Each individual had their own specialist responsibilities and the communication between them was testament to highly honed teamwork.  After the angiogram I was then taken to the ward where the staff there were also marvellous. Thanks so much for the treatment attention and care.

title: Private COVID test for travel
body:
Great service over the holiday period. Test at 2 pm New Year’s Eve results back on the 1st jan at 3 pm. Very unexpected as a holiday. The lady who did the test was great 
Thanks

title: unbelievable
body: 1 month with a terrible sciatica.  whole days on the phone waiting.  to get hung up.  promises and only promises.  from the secretaries.  a shame.

title: Excellent care
body: Many thanks to the Coronary Care Unit at the RLI. I had a few days in there very recently as an emergency admission, and was very well looked after in challenging circumstances. The clinical care was super and I was discharged after three nights with tablets and a care package, and a follow- up telephone call. I found the hospital meal programme very good too. But it was the staff on the unit that made the stay so comfortable, always on hand to tend to personal requirements and always on hand to go the extra mile for my benefit, even to the extent of following me home with an Amazon delivery that missed me in the unit. Thank you very much CCU at the R L I.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Morecambe Bay NHS Foundation Trust

title: Lovely staff
body: Had an MRI of my spine and ended up having a small panic attack while in the MRI machine. I was made to feel at ease and comfortable. Lovely staff!

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Morecambe Bay NHS Foundation Trust

title: Outstanding professional caring service
body: Myself and my son who has special needs attended the emergency eye department on the 30/31st December 2020 the service we received from the different care teams from the female Consultant and her team, theatre staff and all the nursing staff we met  EEU clinic Eye J, theatre department and ward 54 was exemplary, professional caring and had an excellent understanding of my sons needs.  I would be grateful if you could pass on my sons and my families thanks and  gratitude for the treatment, care and support he received.

title: Amazing
body:
Doctors , staff and nurses who actually care about patients .
   Always fit an appointment in if needed . Yea they are flexible .
10 out of 10

title: 5 weeks' wait to see a doctor. Shocking.
body: I have tried to book an appointment online to see a GP. Today is January 1st and the next available date is on the16th February! What is going on? Market Weighton practice is not fit for purpose.

title: Would not recommend
body: Like previous comments getting an appointment is impossible. Rang 4 days in a row 58 times and more. Told no appointments. Rang at 8am on the dot phone engaged constantly.  When I got through no help what so ever told to go to a and e. I mean really. If I ask for an appointment I need one.

title: COVID-19 Vaccination
body:
My wife and I attended to receive our COVID-19 vaccinations on 31st December, having been invited by a telephone call.
The organisation of this procedure was a credit to all those involved.
The staff were all very professional, pleasant and caring and made all recipients feel relaxed prior to and after their injections.
Well done and thank you!
Brian & Sue Worthington

title: Very good unit
body: My visit was extremely nice with good staff and excellent treatment to my back which is an open wound which has to be dressed after hospital daily am very pleased with the unit.

title: Friendly and Kind
body: From the initial appointment at Spamedica Coventry for assessment  to my surgery for a cataract ,they treated me with professionalism and friendliness. Every step was explained fully and concisely. An exceptionally good service.

title: Rude.
body:
Called up for an appointment, and was asked if I could wait a few days for a telephone consultation to which I replied with “I’m in pain and quite worried as it’s been going on for over a week”. The receptionist then rudely says “if it’s been going on that long then you’ll be fine to wait a little bit longer won’t you”. 

I am beyond angry as I NEVER go to the doctors and will never waste their time. I will only go if I feel there is something very wrong. This treatment has been appalling.
